title: Which law of thermodynamics is related to a system reaching 0 K? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Third Law. Which states that the entropy of any substance must vanish at the absolute zero temperature (0 K). Or, alternatively, that the specific heat of any substance must vanish (faster than linearly) at the lowest temperatures. Or, alternatively, that absolute zero cannot be reached with a finite number of transformations.
